subject: Programming
title: Decision Fatigue in Coding
description: A short lesson to help you apply Decision Fatigue in Coding.

hook.text: Every naming choice, architecture decision, and formatting option drains your mental energy.

buildup.text: Decision fatigue means the quality of your choices degrades as you make more decisions in a day.

discovery.text: By late afternoon, developers accept worse designs simply because they're too tired to think harder.

twist.text: Automating small decisions â€” formatters, linters, templates â€” preserves energy for the big ones.

climax.text: The best teams standardize trivial choices so everyone saves brainpower for what truly matters.

punchline.text: Automate small decisions. Save energy for big ones.

quiz.question: How do code formatters help fight decision fatigue?
